9.4. Sharp Hardy-Leray inequality for divergence-free ﬁelds
Let u denote a vector ﬁeld in R^n with components in C^∞_0(R^n). The following n-dimensional generalization of the one-dimensional Hardy inequality [21]

∫_{R^n} |u|^2/|x|^2 dx ≤ 4/(n − 2)^2 ∫_{R^n} |∇u|^2 dx  (9.5)

appears for n = 3 in Leray’s pioneering paper on the Navier-Stokes equations [42]. The constant factor on the right-hand side is sharp. Since one frequently deals with divergence-free ﬁelds in hydrodynamics, it is natural to ask whether this restriction can improve the constant in (9.5).

It is shown in [10] that this is the case indeed if n > 2 and the vector ﬁeld u is axisymmetric by proving that the aforementioned constant can be replaced by the (smaller) optimal value

4/(n − 2)^2 ( 1 − 8/(n + 2)^2 )  (9.6)
